remarks: The factors ` K , L ` of ~ ablfacrp have the expected orders (which allows for repeated application to decompose ` G ` into subgroups of prime-power order).  Lemma 6.1C.2 of [Shapiro], p. 199.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Apr-2016.)
statement:
ablfacrp.b $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
ablfacrp.o $e |- O = ( od ` G ) $.
ablfacrp.k $e |- K = { x e. B | ( O ` x ) || M } $.
ablfacrp.l $e |- L = { x e. B | ( O ` x ) || N } $.
ablfacrp.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. Abel ) $.
ablfacrp.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. NN ) $.
ablfacrp.n $e |- ( ph -> N e. NN ) $.
ablfacrp.1 $e |- ( ph -> ( M gcd N ) = 1 ) $.
ablfacrp.2 $e |- ( ph -> ( # ` B ) = ( M x. N ) ) $.
ablfacrp2 $p |- ( ph -> ( ( # ` K ) = M /\ ( # ` L ) = N ) ) $.
$d B x $.
$d G x $.
$d M x $.
$d N x $.
$d O x $.
$d ph x $.
